meanings.definition: A group of animals being driven in a body.
meanings.sent1: The drove of cows moved slowly across the field.
meanings.sent2: The shepherd led the drove of sheep to the pasture.
meanings.sent3: The drove of ducks waddled in a line, quacking happily.
meanings.sent4: The drove of horses galloped together like a synchronized team.
meanings.sent5: The drove of pigs snorted and rooted in the mud.

meanings.sent1: She drove to the store to buy groceries.
meanings.sent2: He drove carefully on the icy road.
meanings.sent3: The kids drove their parents crazy with their loud music.
meanings.sent4: The rain drove against the window all night long.
meanings.sent5: The wind drove the leaves in swirling patterns.

meanings.definition: A large number of people or things doing something together.
meanings.sent1: The drove of students rushed out of the school after the bell rang.
meanings.sent2: A drove of ants worked together to carry the food back to their nest.
meanings.sent3: The drove of cars in the parking lot created a traffic jam.
meanings.sent4: The drove of birds filled the sky with their synchronized flight.
meanings.sent5: The drove of workers completed the project ahead of schedule.
